title: #11 Measure your calibre
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the remainder when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"15^{23}+23^{23}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is divided by 19."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"15^{23} + 23^{23} = (19 - 4)^{23} + (19 + 4)^{23}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now when we expand these binomials, a factor of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"19"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" will appear in every term of the expansions except the last of each one, so we end up with"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"15^{23} + 23^{23} \equiv (-4)^{23} + 4^{23} \pmod{19} = \boxed{0}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 11 modular 100 Fibonacci? Sounds Crazy!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the sum of all the Fibonacci numbers less than 1 billion which have their last 2 digits same in decimal representation."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details and assumptions","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Fibonacci sequence is defined as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F_0=0,F_1=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n\geq 2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F_n=F_{n-1}+F_{n-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Thus, the Fibonacci sequence is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0,1,1,2,3,5,8,13,\ldots"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"12344 has the last 2 digits same (each being 4), and 12345 does not have it's last 2 digits to be the same."}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This problem is a part of the set Crazy Fibonacci"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Wrote this Code on "},{"type":"text","text":"Python 2.7","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" and Save it as ModFib.py and Ran it"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"codeBlock","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1
2
3
4
5
6
7fibo1, fibo2 = 0, 1
sum = 0
while fibo1 <= 1000000000:
    if (fibo1 % 100) % 11 == 0:
        sum += fibo1
    fibo1, fibo2 = fibo2, fibo1 + fibo2  #Formula for Fibonacci Series
print sum


"}],"attrs":[{"text":"fibo1, fibo2 = 0, 1
sum = 0
while fibo1 <= 1000000000:
    if (fibo1 % 100) % 11 == 0:
        sum += fibo1
    fibo1, fibo2 = fibo2, fibo1 + fibo2  #Formula for Fibonacci Series
print sum
","language":null}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":""}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So it Prints on Screen the value of "},{"type":"text","text":"sum","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" = "},{"type":"text","text":"804079219","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"codeBlock","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 1
 2

11

17from math import *
fib=[0,1]
n=10**9
while fib[-1]<n:
    test=fib[-1]+fib[-2]
    if test<n:
        fib.append(test)
    else:
        break
summ=0
for i in fib:
    try:
        if str(i)[-1]==str(i)[-2]:
            summ+=i
    except(IndexError):
        pass
print summ


"}],"attrs":[{"text":"from math import *
fib=[0,1]
n=10**9
while fib[-1]<n:
    test=fib[-1]+fib[-2]
    if test<n:
        fib.append(test)
    else:
        break
summ=0
for i in fib:
    try:
        if str(i)[-1]==str(i)[-2]:
            summ+=i
    except(IndexError):
        pass
print summ
","language":null}]},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":""}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 11^n and Pascal
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I'm sure that you must have known about Pascal Triangle. If you make the coefficients into numbers in one row, you'll find that is same as 11^n."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the maximum number of n so the numbers combined from coefficients are same as 11^n ? "}]}]}
